taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [For Joachim Christian Timm, 1734–1805, botanist and Burgermeister of Malchin, Mecklenberg]

references.reference: Brassard, G. R. 1979. The moss genus Timmia. 1. Introduction, and revision of T. norvegica and allied taxa. Lindbergia 5: 39–53.
Brassard, G. R. 1980. The moss genus Timmia. 2. Sect. Timmiaurea. Lindbergia 6: 129–136.
Brassard, G. R. 1984. The moss genus Timmia. 3. Sect. Timmia. Lindbergia 10: 33–40.

key_statement.description: Cells at leaf insertion not hyaline and fragile, leaves not readily breaking away from stem.
Leaf sheaths bright, clear orange (appearing red when still on the stem); cilia of endostome non-appendiculate; dioicous [Sect. Timmiaurea]
Leaf sheaths pale, uncoloured or yellowish; cilia of endostome appendiculate; monoicous
Cells at leaf insertion hyaline and fragile, leaves readily breaking away from stem [Sect. Norvegicae].
Abaxial surface of mid-limb cells non-mamillose and non-papillose
Abaxial surface of mid-limb cells mamillose and pluripapillose (as seen in cross section)
